messages.title: Only Lib Dems will protect our NHS
messages.content: Only the Lib Dems are committed to investing the £8bn per year by 2020 the NHS says it needs.

messages.title: Lib Dems deliver extra £1.25bn for children with mental health issues
messages.content: The Lib Dems have provided £1.25bn of new funding to help children with mental health problems.

messages.title: Safer journey to city centre
messages.content: Lib Dems secure safety improvements for pedestrians and cyclists.

messages.title: Council should invest more in housing
messages.content: Lib Dems want to see Labour invest more in affordable housing for local residents.

messages.title: Lib Dems call for library consultation
messages.content: Local Lib Dems are challenging controversial plans to lease the old Manor Community College.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Committed to investing the necessary £8 billion for the NHS per year by 2020.
Delivered £1.25 billion in new funding to help children with mental health issues.
Secured safety improvements for pedestrians and cyclists to ensure a safer journey to the city center.
Advocate for Labour to invest more in affordable housing for local residents.
Challenge the controversial plans to lease the old Manor Community College for a library, calling for consultation and revised thoughtful plans.

mentions.candidate: Damien Tunnacliffe has joined in supporting the Turnpike occupation to Labour’s investment into commercial property holdings.
mentions.tacticalSituation: Just 19 votes in it in West Chesterton. It will be a close race between Damien and the Labour candidate. Conservatives out of the race.

issues.health: Only Lib Dems will protect our NHS with a commitment to invest an additional £8bn by 2020.

housing.content: Lib Dems want to see Labour invest more in affordable housing for local residents. Damien Tunnacliffe has joined in supporting the Turnpike occupation to Labour's handling of investment into commercial property instead of investing in local residential, social housing.

politicalExperience.achievements: Damien Tunnacliffe has welcomed news that the Fort St George bridge will open again shortly due to renovation work.

endorsements.endorser: Dr George Pippas, Mayor of Cambridge
endorsements.endorsement: These changes, along with the resurfacing of Ditton Walk secured by the Lib Dems will ensure pedestrians and cyclists a safer and more pleasant journey into the city center.

quotes.text: 'Labour and Tories refuse to commit to doctors’ £28bn NHS funding plea.' – Guardian, March 2015
